blocks.name: ordtbaslem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ ordtbas . In a total order, unbounded-above intervals are closed under intersection. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: ordtval
blocks.content: Value of the order topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ordtval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(cordt, c0), cfv(ctg, cfv(cfi, cun(csn(c2), cun(c3, c4))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cdm(c0))
  -| wceq(c3, crn(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))))
  -| wceq(c4, crn(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(cordt, c0), cfv(ctg, cfv(cfi, cun(csn(c2), cun(c3, c4)))))), diffsc(s0, c1))

thm ordtval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  âŠ¢ (c0 âˆˆ c1 â†’(ordTop ` c0)=(topGen `(fi `({ c2 } â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)))))
  âŠ£ c2 = dom(c0)

  âŠ£ c4 = ran((s0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c2 | Â¬ s0[c0]s1 }))

  âŠ£ d(s0, c1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 âˆˆ c1 â†’(ordTop ` c0)=(topGen `(fi `({ c2 } â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4))))), d(s0, c1))

  syl(c0 âˆˆ c1, (ordTop ` c0)=(topGen `(fi `({ c2 } â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)))), c0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  elex(c0, c1)
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, cordt, (topGen `(fi `({ c2 } â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)))), (topGen `(fi `({ dom(hs0)} â‹ƒ ran(((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 })â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 })))))))
  fveq2d(ctg, (fi `({ dom(hs0)} â‹ƒ ran(((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 })â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 }))))), (fi `({ c2 } â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4))), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2d(cfi, ({ dom(hs0)} â‹ƒ ran(((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 })â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 })))), ({ c2 } â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)), hs0 = c0)
  uneq12d({ dom(hs0)}, ran(((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 })â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 }))), { c2 }, (c3 â‹ƒ c4), hs0 = c0)
  sneqd(dom(hs0), c2, hs0 = c0)
  syl5eq(ran(((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 })â‹ƒ(s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 }))), (c3 â‹ƒ c4), (ran((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 }))â‹ƒ ran((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 }))), hs0 = c0)
  rnun((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 }), (s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 }))
  uneq12d(ran((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 })), ran((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s0[hs0]s1 })), c3, c4, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr(ran((s0 âˆˆ dom(hs0)â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ dom(hs0)| Â¬ s1[hs0]s0 })), c3, ran((s0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c2 | Â¬ s1[c0]s0 })), hs0 = c0)

  df-ordt(hs0, s0, s1)

thm ordtuni(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cuni(cun(csn(c2), cun(c3, c4)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cdm(c0))
  -| wceq(c3, crn(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))))
  -| wceq(c4, crn(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cuni(cun(csn(c2), cun(c3, c4))))), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cuni(cun(csn(c2), cun(c3, c4))))), diffsc(s1, c0))
  syl6eqr(c2, cuni(cun(csn(c2), cun(c3, c4))), cun(cuni(csn(c2)), cuni(cun(c3, c4))), wcel(c0, c1))
  eqtr2d(c2, cun(cuni(csn(c2)), cuni(cun(c3, c4))), cun(c2, cuni(cun(c3, c4))), wcel(c0, c1))
  uneq1d(cuni(csn(c2)), cuni(cun(c3, c4)), c2, wcel(c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cuni(csn(c2)), c2), wcel(c2, universe))
  unisng(c2, universe)
  sylib(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cun(c2, cuni(cun(c3, c4))), c2), wss(cuni(cun(c3, c4)), c2))
  sylib(wcel(c0, c1), wss(cuni(cun(c3, c4)), c2), wss(cun(c3, c4), cpw(c2)))
  unssd(c3, c4, cpw(c2), wcel(c0, c1))
  syl5eqss(c3, cpw(c2), crn(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))), wcel(c0, c1))
  frnd(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), cpw(c2), c2, wcel(c0, c1))
  fmpttd(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))), cpw(c2), wcel(c0, c1))
  mpbiri(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wcel(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))), cpw(c2)), wss(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))), c2))
  ssrab2(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wb(wcel(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))), cpw(c2)), wss(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))), c2)), wcel(c2, universe))
  elpw2g(c2, universe, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))
  syl5eqss(c4, cpw(c2), crn(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))))), wcel(c0, c1))
  frnd(cmpt(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))), cpw(c2), c2, wcel(c0, c1))
  fmpttd(s0, c2, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))), cpw(c2), wcel(c0, c1))
  mpbiri(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wcel(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))), cpw(c2)), wss(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))), c2))
  ssrab2(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wb(wcel(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))), cpw(c2)), wss(crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))), c2)), wcel(c2, universe))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(c2, universe))
  syl5eqel(c2, universe, cdm(c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  dmexg(c0, c1)
  elpw2g(c2, universe, crab(s1, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)))))
  sspwuni(cun(c3, c4), c2)
  ssequn2(cuni(cun(c3, c4)), c2)
  uniun(csn(c2), cun(c3, c4))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
}

thm ordtuni(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  âŠ¢ (c0 âˆˆ c1 â†’ c2 = â‹ƒ({ c2 } â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)))
  âŠ£ c2 = dom(c0)

  eqtr2d(c2, (â‹ƒ { c2 } â‹ƒ â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)), (c2 â‹ƒ â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)), c0 âˆˆ c1)
  uneq1d(â‹ƒ { c2 }, â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4), c2, c0 âˆˆ c1)
  syl(c0 âˆˆ c1, â‹ƒ { c2 } = c2, c2 âˆˆ ğ•Œ)

  sylib(c0 âˆˆ c1, (c2 â‹ƒ â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4))= c2, â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)âŠ† c2)
  sylib(c0 âˆˆ c1, â‹ƒ(c3 â‹ƒ c4)âŠ† c2, (c3 â‹ƒ c4)âŠ† P(c2))
  unssd(c3, c4, P(c2), c0 âˆˆ c1)
  syl5eqss(c3, P(c2), ran((s0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c2 | Â¬ s1[c0]s0 })), c0 âˆˆ c1)
  frnd((s0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c2 | Â¬ s1[c0]s0 }), P(c2), c2, c0 âˆˆ c1)
  fmpttd(s0, c2, { s1 âˆˆ c2 | Â¬ s1[c0]s0 }, P(c2), c0 âˆˆ c1)

blocks.name: ordtbas
blocks.content: In a total order, the finite intersections of the open rays generates the set of open intervals, but no more - these four collections form a subbasis for the order topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)

thm ordtcld2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

} = {
  mpbir2and(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(crab(s0, c3, wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0))), cfv(ccld, cfv(cordt, c0))), wss(crab(s0, c3, wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0))), cuni(cfv(cordt, c0))), wcel(cdif(cuni(cfv(cordt, c0)), crab(s0, c3, wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0)))), cfv(cordt, c0)))

  syl5eqr(crab(s0, c3, wn(wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0)))), cdif(cuni(cfv(cordt, c0)), crab(s0, c3, wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0)))), cdif(c3, crab(s0, c3, wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  notrab(s0, c3, wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0)))
  difeq1d(c3, crab(s0, c3, wbr(c2, c0, cv(s0))), cuni(cfv(cordt, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c3, cuni(cfv(cordt, c0))), wcel(cfv(cordt, c0), cfv(ctopon, c3)))

  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(cfv(cordt, c0), cfv(ctopon, c3)))
  ordttopon(c0, c1, c3)
  topontop(cfv(cordt, c0), c3)

  adantr(c0 âˆˆ c1, c2 âˆˆ c3, (ordTop ` c0)âˆˆ(TopOn ` c3))

blocks.name: ordtrest
blocks.content: The subspace topology of an order topology is in general finer than the topology generated by the restricted order, but we do have inclusion in one direction. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: ordtrest2
blocks.content: An interval-closed set ` A ` in a total order has the same subspace topology as the restricted order topology. (An interval-closed set is the same thing as an open or half-open or closed interval in ` RR ` , but in other sets like ` QQ ` there are interval-closed sets like ` ( _pi , +oo ) i^i QQ ` that are not intervals.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ordtrest2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cordt, cin(c0, cxp(c1, c1))), co(cfv(cordt, c0), crest, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, cdm(c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ctsr))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, c2))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1))), wss(crab(s2, c2, wa(wbr(cv(s0), c0, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1)))), c1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  eqssd(cfv(cordt, cin(c0, cxp(c1, c1))), co(cfv(cordt, c0), crest, c1), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wss(cfv(cordt, cin(c0, cxp(c1, c1))), co(cfv(cordt, c0), crest, c1)), wcel(c0, cps), wcel(c1, universe))
  ordtrest(c0, c1, universe)
  eqsstrd(co(cfv(cordt, c0), crest, c1), cfv(cordt, cin(c0, cxp(c1, c1))), cfv(ctg, cfv(cfi, co(cun(csn(c2), cun(crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s2)))))), crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(hs0)))))))), crest, c1))), w0)
  syl6eqr(co(cfv(cordt, c0), crest, c1), cfv(ctg, cfv(cfi, co(cun(csn(c2), cun(crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s2)))))), crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(hs0)))))))), crest, c1))), cfv(ctg, co(cfv(cfi, cun(csn(c2), cun(crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s2)))))), crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(hs0))))))))), crest, c1)), w0)
  eqtr4d(co(cfv(cordt, c0), crest, c1), cfv(ctg, co(cfv(cfi, cun(csn(c2), cun(crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s2)))))), crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(hs0))))))))), crest, c1)), co(cfv(ctg, cfv(cfi, cun(csn(c2), cun(crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s2)))))), crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(hs0)))))))))), crest, c1), w0)
  oveq1d(cfv(cordt, c0), crest, c1, cfv(ctg, cfv(cfi, cun(csn(c2), cun(crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s2)))))), crn(cmpt(s2, c2, crab(hs0, c2, wn(wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(hs0)))))))))), w0)

  rneqi(cmpt(s0, cxr, co(cv(s0), cioc, cpnf)), cmpt(s0, cxr, crab(s1, cxr, wn(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s0))))))

  mpbi(wceq(cin(cxr, co(cv(s0), cioc, cpnf)), co(cv(s0), cioc, cpnf)), wss(co(cv(s0), cioc, cpnf), cxr))
  iocssxr(cv(s0), cpnf)

  3bitr2d(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cxr), wcel(cv(s1), cxr)), wcel(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), cioc, cpnf)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), cle, cv(s0))), w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cxr), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cpnf)), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)))

  simpl(wcel(cv(s0), cxr), wcel(cv(s1), cxr))

  syl6bbr(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cxr), wcel(cv(s1), cxr)), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cxr), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cpnf)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cxr), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cpnf)), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1))))
  biantrurd(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cxr), wcel(cv(s1), cxr)), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cxr), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cpnf)))
  jccir(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cxr), wcel(cv(s1), cxr)), wcel(cv(s1), cxr), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cpnf))
  simpr(wcel(cv(s0), cxr), wcel(cv(s1), cxr))
  pnfge(cv(s1))
  3anan32(wcel(cv(s1), cxr), wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cpnf))
  xrltnle(cv(s0), cv(s1))

blocks.name: reordt
blocks.content: The real numbers are an open set in the topology of the extended reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: lecldbas
blocks.content: The set of closed intervals forms a closed subbasis for the topology on the extended reals. Since our definition of a basis is in terms of open sets, we express this by showing that the complements of closed intervals form an open subbasis for the topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: pnfnei
blocks.content: A neighborhood of ` +oo ` contains an unbounded interval based at a real number. Together with ~ xrtgioo (which describes neighborhoods of ` RR ` ) and ~ mnfnei , this gives all "negative" topological information ensuring that it is not too fine (and of course ~ iooordt and similar ensure that it has all the sets we want). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: mnfnei
blocks.content: A neighborhood of ` -oo ` contains an unbounded interval based at a real number. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

} = {
  sylanb(wcel(c0, cfv(cordt, cle)), wcel(cmnf, c0), wrex(s0, cr, wss(co(cmnf, cico, cv(s0)), c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctg, cun(cun(crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cv(hs0), cioc, cpnf))), crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cmnf, cico, cv(hs0))))), crn(cioo)))))
  eleq2i(c0, cfv(cordt, cle), cfv(ctg, cun(cun(crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cv(hs0), cioc, cpnf))), crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cmnf, cico, cv(hs0))))), crn(cioo))))

  eqid(crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cv(hs0), cioc, cpnf))))
  eqid(crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cmnf, cico, cv(hs0)))))
  eqid(crn(cioo))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctg, cun(cun(crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cv(hs0), cioc, cpnf))), crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cmnf, cico, cv(hs0))))), crn(cioo)))), wcel(cmnf, c0)), wrex(s0, cr, wss(co(cmnf, cico, cv(s0)), c0)), wrex(hs1, cun(cun(crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cv(hs0), cioc, cpnf))), crn(cmpt(hs0, cxr, co(cmnf, cico, cv(hs0))))), crn(cioo)), wa(wcel(cmnf, cv(hs1)), wss(cv(hs1), c0))))

  sseli(cv(s0), c0, cxr)
